document_data.caption: A teak serpent above and herald serpent below.
document_data.name: Teak Serpent
document_data.mainbody: '''Teak serpents''', or '''teak snakes''',{{Cite organized play/LC/Where the Teak Snakes Slither|7}} were a type of huge constrictor snake found only in the vast jungles of the [[Cities of the Ancients]] region of [[east Zakhara]], specifically in parts of the jungle with teak or ironwood trees.
document_data.Description: Teak serpents could reach lengths exceeding {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}}. Their hardened scales resembled those of the hardwood trees they inhabited, providing them with protection and natural camouflage.
document_data.Combat: Teak serpents preferred to surprise their prey by dropping on it from above with a combined attack involving a bite and constriction. Given their size and strength a teak serpent was capable of constricting up to three [[human]]-sized creatures at the same time.
document_data.Habitat/Society: Teak serpents were feared predators in their natural habitats. Their preferred prey item was a baby [[elephant]], but they would consume anything they could overpower. They would typically sleep for a week after feeding.
document_data.Ecology: These serpents ate live prey appropriate for a snake of their size. Their scales were harvested to add protective bonuses to the ''[[barkskin]]'' spell. Teak serpents were also captured by [[kahin]]s and bound into [[Staff of the Teak Serpent|magical staves]].
